metadata.title: USN-6070-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that the Traffic-Control Index (TCINDEX) implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform filter deactivation in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to gain elevated privileges. Please note that with the fix for this CVE, kernel support for the TCINDEX classifier has been removed. (CVE-2023-1829)  It was discovered that a race condition existed in the io_uring subsystem in the Linux kernel, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2023-1872)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6070-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-headers-5.15.0-1028-raspi - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-modules-extra-5.15.0-1028-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-raspi-headers-5.15.0-1028 - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-modules-5.15.0-1028-raspi - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-modules-extra-5.15.0-1028-raspi - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-raspi-tools-5.15.0-1028 - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-tools-5.15.0-1028-raspi - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-modules-5.15.0-1028-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-headers-5.15.0-1028-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-image-5.15.0-1028-raspi - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-buildinfo-5.15.0-1028-raspi - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-image-5.15.0-1028-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-buildinfo-5.15.0-1028-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1028.30 linux-tools-5.15.0-1028-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1028.30 No subscription required  linux-tools-raspi - 5.15.0.1028.25 linux-modules-extra-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0.1028.25 linux-tools-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0.1028.25 linux-headers-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0.1028.25 linux-image-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0.1028.25 linux-image-raspi - 5.15.0.1028.25 linux-modules-extra-raspi - 5.15.0.1028.25 linux-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0.1028.25 linux-raspi - 5.15.0.1028.25 linux-headers-raspi - 5.15.0.1028.25 No subscription required
